title: test_storage_apply_snapshot possible invalid memory write
body:
## Bug Report

```
$EXTRA_CARGO_ARGS="test_storage_apply_snapshot" make dev
...
test raftstore::store::peer_storage::tests::test_storage_apply_snapshot ... ok

test result: ok. 1 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 620 filtered out

error: process didn't exit successfully: `/Users/breezewish/Work/PingCAP/tikv/target/debug/deps/tikv-33f46b45de73e2a8 test_storage_apply_snapshot --nocapture` (signal: 11, SIGSEGV: invalid memory reference)
make[1]: *** [test] Error 101
make: *** [dev] Error 2
```


comments_data.body: At a glance this seems to be either an out of bounds memory acess or a use-after-free, both of which are exploitable security vulnerabilities. If that is the case, please add this issue to the [Rust security advisory database](https://github.com/RustSec/advisory-db) and/or [apply for a CVE](https://iwantacve.org) so people could check if they're running a vulnerable version and upgrade.
@Shnatsel Hi, there is a mistake in the test code and this issue does not affect the application itself. In addition, TiKV is not published as a library, so don't worry :)
